definition: to support the weak and restrain the strong (idiom); robbing the rich to help the poor
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
distributing money, fighting for virtue (idiom); fig. generous in helping the needy
to remove perils and solve disputes (idiom); to reconcile differences
to help the needy for justice (idiom); to be loyal to one's friends and generous to the needy
lit. to rescue the people from hanging upside down (idiom, from Mencius); to save the people from dire straits
to root out the strong and support the weak (idiom); to rob the rich and give to the poor
to bring peace and stability to the country
anxious to help others resolve difficulties (idiom)
to value righteousness rather than material gain (idiom)
